Sentencas: Proton-conducting electrolytes with high conductivity and long-term stability, achievable at low sintering temperatures, are of paramount importance.
Titulo: Design of a highly stable and conductive electrolyte by suppressing barium copper oxide formation at the grain interfaces in Cux-doped BaCe0.7Zr0.1Dy0.2-xO3-δ sintered at a low temperature (1200 °C) for SOFCs

Sentencas: In this study, we investigate the impact of Cu doping on the sintering mechanism, electrical performance, and stability of BaCe0.7Zr0.1Dy0.2-xO3-delta (BCZD) electrolyte.
Titulo: Design of a highly stable and conductive electrolyte by suppressing barium copper oxide formation at the grain interfaces in Cux-doped BaCe0.7Zr0.1Dy0.2-xO3-δ sintered at a low temperature (1200 °C) for SOFCs

Sentencas: The morphology, composition, structure, and chemical state of BCZD electrolytes were investigated using scanning electron microscopy (SEM), energy-dispersive X-ray spectroscopy (EDX), X-ray diffraction (XRD), and X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS).
Titulo: Design of a highly stable and conductive electrolyte by suppressing barium copper oxide formation at the grain interfaces in Cux-doped BaCe0.7Zr0.1Dy0.2-xO3-δ sintered at a low temperature (1200 °C) for SOFCs

Sentencas: Remarkably, the sintering temperature of BCZD is reduced to 1200 degrees C through Cu doping Furthermore, the introduction of Cu as a dopant induces Ba exsolution from the BCZD crystal lattice alongside the generation of oxygen vacancies.
Titulo: Design of a highly stable and conductive electrolyte by suppressing barium copper oxide formation at the grain interfaces in Cux-doped BaCe0.7Zr0.1Dy0.2-xO3-δ sintered at a low temperature (1200 °C) for SOFCs

Sentencas: XPS measurements confirmed that vacancy concentrations increase with increasing Cu doping concentrations.
Titulo: Design of a highly stable and conductive electrolyte by suppressing barium copper oxide formation at the grain interfaces in Cux-doped BaCe0.7Zr0.1Dy0.2-xO3-δ sintered at a low temperature (1200 °C) for SOFCs

Sentencas: However, as the Cu content surpasses 2 mol%, the exsoluted Cu reacts with Ba, leading to the formation of BaCuO2.
Titulo: Design of a highly stable and conductive electrolyte by suppressing barium copper oxide formation at the grain interfaces in Cux-doped BaCe0.7Zr0.1Dy0.2-xO3-δ sintered at a low temperature (1200 °C) for SOFCs

Sentencas: Accumulation of BaCuO2 at the grain boundaries adversely affects the conductivity and stability of Cu-doped BCZD, in a humidified atmosphere where it exhibits significant instability.
Titulo: Design of a highly stable and conductive electrolyte by suppressing barium copper oxide formation at the grain interfaces in Cux-doped BaCe0.7Zr0.1Dy0.2-xO3-δ sintered at a low temperature (1200 °C) for SOFCs

Sentencas: Notably, BCZD with 2 mol% Cu content demonstrates a conductivity of 2.7 x 10(-2)
Titulo: Design of a highly stable and conductive electrolyte by suppressing barium copper oxide formation at the grain interfaces in Cux-doped BaCe0.7Zr0.1Dy0.2-xO3-δ sintered at a low temperature (1200 °C) for SOFCs

Sentencas: S cm(-1) and maintains stability for up to 420 h in the H-2/3%H2O atmosphere at 600 degrees C.
Titulo: Design of a highly stable and conductive electrolyte by suppressing barium copper oxide formation at the grain interfaces in Cux-doped BaCe0.7Zr0.1Dy0.2-xO3-δ sintered at a low temperature (1200 °C) for SOFCs

Sentencas: In contrast, BCZD with 5 mol% Cu content exhibits a conductivity of 1.9 x 10(-2)
Titulo: Design of a highly stable and conductive electrolyte by suppressing barium copper oxide formation at the grain interfaces in Cux-doped BaCe0.7Zr0.1Dy0.2-xO3-δ sintered at a low temperature (1200 °C) for SOFCs

Sentencas: S cm(-1) at 600 degrees C but experiences continuous degradation in a humidified atmosphere, ultimately leading to failure within 30 h. The 2 % Cu-doped BCZD exhibits high conductivity and stability at intermediate temperatures, rendering it highly suitable for solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) applications.
Titulo: Design of a highly stable and conductive electrolyte by suppressing barium copper oxide formation at the grain interfaces in Cux-doped BaCe0.7Zr0.1Dy0.2-xO3-δ sintered at a low temperature (1200 °C) for SOFCs
